meanings.definition: To enclose in a shrine or holy place.
meanings.sent1: The ancient relic was inshrined in the temple for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The family inshrined the precious heirloom in a beautiful glass case.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel inshrined the acorn in a tiny toy chest.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of childhood were inshrined in the walls of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The love letter was inshrined in a secret compartment of the jewelry box.

meanings.definition: To preserve or cherish as sacred or precious.
meanings.sent1: The community inshrined the tradition of storytelling for future generations.
meanings.sent2: She inshrined the memory of her grandmother by wearing her locket every day.
meanings.sent3: The little girl inshrined her favorite toy by placing it on a velvet cushion.
meanings.sent4: The artist inshrined the beauty of nature in his breathtaking paintings.
meanings.sent5: The friendship they shared was inshrined in a special photo album.
